perturbation.original_text: Cash Sales shall exclude any merchant fees, taxes, shipping, refunds (e.g., returns, right of rescission, NSF checks, and credit card chargebacks), rebates, and bad debt
perturbation.changed_text: Cash Sales shall exclude any merchant fees, taxes, shipping, rebates, and bad debt
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'refunds (e.g., returns, right of rescission, NSF checks, and credit card chargebacks)' from the definition of 'Cash Sales,' the agreement now calculates royalties on amounts that consumers are legally entitled to have refunded under various consumer protection laws. This omission creates a legal contradiction, as it effectively charges royalties on sales that are not finalized due to consumer rights like returns and rescission.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Various state and federal consumer protection laws, including those governing rights of rescission for certain types of sales (e.g., timeshares, door-to-door sales) and rights of return.

perturbation.original_text: LEA shall defend, hold harmless and indemnify T&B and T&B’s agents and employees from and against any and all claims, demands, losses, disputes, causes of action or damages, including, without limitation, FTC actions or other regulatory actions, and/or attorneys’ fees arising out of or relating to the promotion, distribution and/or sale of any financial education programs, products or services, including (but not limited to) live presentations, print advertising, radio advertising, direct mail, outbound calls, email marketing, affiliate marketing, online advertising, infomercials and other marketing methods, by or through LEA, In any instance to which such indemnities pertain, LEA shall obtain and maintain necessary insurance, including, without limitation, Commercial General Liability Insurance, including product liability insurance, trademark infringement, copyright infringement, defamation, contractual liability and personal and advertising injury liability insurance in an amount no less than ten million dollars ($10,000,000.00) per occurrence and ten million dollars ($10,000,000.00) aggregate combined single limit. T&B and Tarek El Moussa shall be named as an additional insured on such insurance and proof of such inclusion shall be provided to T&B.
perturbation.changed_text: LEA shall defend, hold harmless and indemnify T&B and T&B’s agents and employees from and against any and all claims, demands, losses, disputes, causes of action or damages, including, without limitation, FTC actions or other regulatory actions, and/or attorneys’ fees arising out of or relating to the promotion, distribution and/or sale of any financial education programs, products or services, including (but not limited to) live presentations, print advertising, radio advertising, direct mail, outbound calls, email marketing, affiliate marketing, online advertising, infomercials and other marketing methods, by or through LEA, In any instance to which such indemnities pertain, LEA shall obtain and maintain necessary insurance, including Commercial General Liability Insurance. T&B and Tarek El Moussa may be named as an additional insured on such insurance and proof of such inclusion may be provided to T&B.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of specific types of insurance and the specific amount of insurance coverage significantly weakens the insurance requirement. Also, changing 'shall' to 'may' makes this entire section optional. This creates a legal contradiction with state laws that mandate specific minimum coverage amounts for businesses operating within their jurisdiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State laws regarding minimum insurance coverage for businesses and advertising liability.

perturbation.original_text: For each Base Royalty and Marketing Royalty payment (collectively, “Royalty Payment”), LEA shall render to T&B, a written statement, in such form as T&B may reasonably request, setting forth Cash Sales made during the period to which the Royalty Payment relates, and such other information as T&B may reasonably request to verify the Royalty Payments due hereunder. LEA shall keep such written records respecting Cash Sales as T&B may reasonably request so that Royalty Payments payable hereunder may be accurately determined and shall permit such records to be examined by T&B or its authorized representative upon reasonable prior written notice at any reasonable time during regular business hours to verify the records, reports and payments herein provided.
perturbation.changed_text: For each Base Royalty and Marketing Royalty payment (collectively, “Royalty Payment”), LEA shall render to T&B, a written statement, setting forth Cash Sales made during the period to which the Royalty Payment relates. LEA shall keep such written records respecting Cash Sales so that Royalty Payments payable hereunder may be accurately determined.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the phrases 'in such form as T&B may reasonably request, and such other information as T&B may reasonably request to verify the Royalty Payments due hereunder' and 'and shall permit such records to be examined by T&B or its authorized representative upon reasonable prior written notice at any reasonable time during regular business hours to verify the records, reports and payments herein provided' weakens T&B's ability to audit and verify LEA's royalty calculations. Many states have implied covenants of good faith and fair dealing in contracts, and this change hinders T&B's ability to ensure that LEA is acting in good faith in reporting Cash Sales and paying royalties. This could violate those implied covenants.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenants of good faith and fair dealing present in contract law in most US states, including New York (the governing law of the contract).
